forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West northwest wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 7 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

weather_report:
Tonight in Downtown San Francisco, a soft veil of clouds drapes the sky, casting a gentle warmth that lingers on the city streets. As the temperature nudges down to a comfortable 50 degrees, a light west-northwest breeze whispers through the alleys, inviting a reflective stroll or a quiet gathering with friends. The humidity is palpable, yet there's no sign of the infamous fog rolling in, allowing a clear view of the city’s silhouette against the fading light—a promise of a slightly brighter day ahead.

Tomorrow invites a shift to mostly sunny skies, ushering in a high that flirts with 56 degrees before dipping into a mild afternoon chill. The west-northwest wind will pick up, fostering a fresh, invigorating atmosphere that will guide pedestrians along the Embarcadero or through Golden Gate Park. As the day unfolds, it’s a time for light layers—a cozy sweater with perhaps a light jacket for the evening hours ahead. A calm afternoon spent exploring local cafés or engaging in spontaneous conversations with fellow city dwellers would be a delightful way to soak in the peaceful pulse of San Francisco on an early January day.
